## Honours in Statistics at UP

This website contains information on the research active groups and researchers within the Department of Statistics at the University of Pretoria.
Use this information to apply for a project hosted by a specific researcher using the Application tab.


```{r, echo = F}
#| message: false
#| warning: false

library(plotly)

set.seed(123)

n <- 300
x1 <- runif(n, -2, 2)
x2 <- runif(n, -2, 2)
y  <- 1 + 2*x1 - x2 + rnorm(n, 0, 0.5)

df <- data.frame(x1, x2, y)

fit <- lm(y ~ x1 + x2)

grid <- expand.grid(
  x1 = seq(-2, 2, length = 40),
  x2 = seq(-2, 2, length = 40)
)
grid$yhat <- predict(fit, grid)

plot_ly() |>
  add_markers(
    data = df,
    x = ~x1, y = ~x2, z = ~y,
    marker = list(size = 3),
    name = "Observed data"
  ) |>
  add_surface(
    x = matrix(grid$x1, 40),
    y = matrix(grid$x2, 40),
    z = matrix(grid$yhat, 40),
    opacity = 0.7,
    name = "Fitted surface"
  ) |>
  layout(
    title = "3D Linear Regression Surface",
    scene = list(
      xaxis = list(title = "X₁"),
      yaxis = list(title = "X₂"),
      zaxis = list(title = "Y")
    )
  )

```
